Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 1 -- 7.22 Mills Continuation - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Claiborne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a seven and twenty-two hundredths (7.22) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $978,310 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purpose of constructing, improving and/or maintaining Parish roads, streets and bridges, including acquiring, maintaining and/or operating equipment used in connection therewith, said millage to represent a twenty-two hundredths of a mill (.22) increase over the 7 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2017 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2007?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Prop. No. 2 -- 2.06 Mills Continuation - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Claiborne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two and six hundredths (2.06) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation within the Parish (an estimated $279,130 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purpose of acquiring, maintaining and/or operating equipment for constructing, improving and/or maintaining Parish roads, streets and bridges, said millage to represent a six hundredths of a mill (.06) increase over the 2 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2017 pursuant to an election held on October 20, 2007?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax District -- 1% S&U - PJ - 10 Yrs
Race.FullText: Shall Claiborne Parish Sales Tax District (consisting of the entire Parish of Claiborne except those portions of the Parish contained within the corporate boundaries of the municipalities of Homer or Haynesville) (the "District"), under the provisions of Louisiana law, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") (an estimated $630,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year) upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales of services in the District, all as defined by law, for a period of ten (10) years from January 1, 2017, with the proceeds of the Tax (after paying the expenses of collecting and administering the Tax) to be dedicated and used for the purposes of paying the costs of (i) providing for solid waste collection and disposal in the District, including acquiring, improving, maintaining and/or operating the necessary land, facilities and equipment required in connection therewith, and (ii) materials required for surfacing and maintaining public roads within the boundaries of the District?
